solution_line_template: Making the round trip to school means driving from the house to school and then back, for a total of {school_distance_one_way}+{school_distance_one_way} = <<{school_distance_one_way}+{school_distance_one_way}={school_round_trip}>>{school_round_trip} miles
He makes this trip twice in one day for a total of {school_trips_per_day}*{school_round_trip} = <<{school_trips_per_day}*{school_round_trip}={daily_school_mileage}>>{daily_school_mileage} miles

He does this {school_days_per_week} times in a week for a total of {school_days_per_week}*{daily_school_mileage} = <<{school_days_per_week}*{daily_school_mileage}={weekly_school_mileage}>>{weekly_school_mileage} miles.

The round trip (once a week) to the market is {market_distance_one_way}+{market_distance_one_way} = <<{market_distance_one_way}+{market_distance_one_way}={market_round_trip}>>{market_round_trip} miles.
His total mileage for a typical week = {weekly_school_mileage}+{market_round_trip} = <<{weekly_school_mileage}+{market_round_trip}={total_weekly_mileage}>>{total_weekly_mileage} miles
